intro: Aeollanthus namibiensis, commonly known as the Namibian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Namib Desert. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has succulent leaves adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It typically grows in rocky soils and is found in coastal areas of Namibia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
